name: liteCam Game: 100 FPS Game Capture
description: Discover the ultimate game recorder, ‘liteCam Game: 100FPS Game Capture’.‘liteCam Game: 100FPS Game Capture’ is a recorder with easy and simplified interface that captures game play with HD quality output with audio and no lagging. Capture game play with high Frame rates with both game sound and audio commentary Today!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, 7 and 8. Processor: 2GHz Dual-Core CPU or Better. Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 512MB video memory or more. And A graphic card supporting DirectX 9 and WDDM driver. DirectX: Version 7.0 Sound Card: A sound card that supports full-duplexing required. Additional Notes: Windows 2000 is not supported.
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 and 8. Processor: Intel Core i5/i7 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: 1GB video memory or more. DirectX: Version 7.0 Sound Card: A sound card that supports full-duplexing required. Additional Notes: It might drop frames when recording if your computer becomes overburdened or the game play limit FPS less than 100FPS.

Negative! As long as this situation is not going to change so will my 'recommendation' remain! First try out the available free vesion before rushing into this purchase!  This software may record beautiful video & crystalclear/synchronized sound indeed but however I do not appreciate to sacrifice invaluable Frames-per-seconds. 30 FPS in Killing Floor & Garry's Mod. Seriously? RSUPPORT listen here: You have to work on it! Not everybody has the absolute expensive Hi-End hardware to deal with liteCam 100 FPS Game Capture. I have tried different methods multiple times such as lowering bitrate, lowering settings, changing video codec. Whatever was available did not help. FPS were always +/- 30.  I have already sent a message to RSUPPORT about this issue. I see they were patching their software somewhat in the past. RSUPPORT you have to focus on getting decent 60 FPS on decent computers. My hardware is capable of managing giant programming. FRAPS & Hypercam 2 never had a problem with FPS. FPS is the main troublesome issue here. My drivers are all already up to date! Double checked!  Motherboard: ASUS M4N78 Pro CPU: AMD Phenom II X4 945 (4x3 GHz) RAM: 2x2 GB @ 800 Mhz GPU: Gigabyte Geforce 670 GTX 2GB WF3 PSU: 920W MS-Tech Monitor: Packard Bell Maestro 235DL (1920x1080 @ 60Hz) OS: Windows 7 Professional 64-Bit Virusfree, clean and well-operating machine.  What are the benefits of liteCam Game: 100 FPS Game Capture? - First of all it was on a fair discount here on Steam, which has attracted my attention. I grabbed it while I still could. - Customizeable video capturing very easy: from videosettings trough audiosettings you can choose whatever you wish. - Recorded videos unlike FRAPS do not chew up gigabytes for minutes. - Easy-to-use - Wish to record activities on desktop? No problem! This mode is available with 100% sharpness & customizations for the mouse. - Record Stereo Mix (a.k.a. What u hear) and Microphone simultaneously (without seperate audiorecordings). - For some inexperienced comes up an integrated feature to add titles, logos and some other stuff to their video.  What does liteCam Game: 100 FPS Game Capture lack off?: -  (Main reason)  Even on good machines you will get - unlike FRAPS - lesser FPS while recording, which will follow in the review of your freshly recorded video. This has been in Killing Floor and Garry's mod tested by me.  SO YEAH! AFTER ALL I STILL HAVE TO STICK WITH THE GIGABYTE-CONSUMING FRAPS. FRAPS WONT AT LEAST DROP DOWN PRECIOUS FPS AS HORRIBLE AS LITECAM DOES, SO I STILL HAVE GOT NO BLOODY CHOICE. I learned my lesson the hard way. I admit this is the first time, that I feel like I got robbed for good-for-nothing trashware (YET TODAY!). I never before realized, that a free version of liteCam was available for testing. I was into the purchase rush because of the nice discount and somewhat attracting provided content. I was wrong! They are wrong yet today (unless a better update is coming out to beat the capabilities of FRAPS truly)!  The other top-rated negative reviews said nothing realy more than 'This software is a piece of $hiet...'. These were however not helpful to prove, that liteCam is not worth buying for their incapabilities. Here I am the first one, who warns crystal-clearly you fellow readers. Avoid this program. Unless it is going to be updated properly with TRUE capabilities of taking TRUE 100(60) FPS. Until then I will edit this review!  RSUPPORT! LISTEN HERE! FIX IT! WORK ON IT!

I tried converting the file to WMV, and that seemed to go ok, but the random time glitch seems present still.  This was before they reqired another update. Now I can't get my program to update, and this is entirely moot. Hoping it is fixed shortly so I can play around with it more.  UPDATE: The program runs now, but the video converter seems borked. I can't get it to recognize that I've selected an original file to convert. Hoping this is remedied soon.

Lite cam gave me so many issues later on. It wouldn't record properly, it barely picked up my microphone, and it would stop responding all the time.  Lite cam does work once in a while, and is easy to use, but Action! is easier to use, automatically lets you output to .mp4 instead of .avi (which is a huge difference in file size I might add) and it sounds GREAT.
